Name: PostHumous Z
Description:
There has been a zombie outbreak! The cameras focus in a small town, where a band of cliché characters has holed up, waiting for rescue. It never comes. Worse still, the zombies continue to grow in number and intelligence. A conclusion is drawn: If the characters wish to survive, they must make a break for the outskirts and escape the town. Will anyone be left when the credits roll?

PostHumousZ is a team based zombie survival horror game. Each player controls a single human character or horde of themed zombies. A modular town is randomly laid out each game, with the safe house at one end and the escape on the other. Likewise, every character and zombie theme is randomly generated by combining 3 cards giving each player, and team, its own strengths and weaknesses.

The humans must move through the town to the escape, collecting items, rescuing nameless survivors (extras), fighting zombies, and hiding at strategic moments. Zombies killed by the characters are taken as points, and are spent to activate abilities and buy powerful plot changing cards (H-cards). The zombies in turn spawn and direct the undead, collect hunger (zombies’ resource) and use their cards and abilities to overwhelm the humans before they escape. Unlike the humans, the zombies’ plot cards (Z-cards) are drawn freely over time as well as purchased, meaning the clock is against the living. Gameplay is dynamic as both teams are affected by random events and changes in their opponents’ strategy.

PostHumousZ 295 unique cards add near endless variation, depth, drama and humor to each game, while simple base rules and bold art make it quick to learn, easy to keep track of, and low on downtime.

Name: Teach Key Math
Description: A 3M EduPLAYtional game. A "schoolhouse" holds cards that show basic math problems. Insert the key (a peg) into the hole with the correct answer and the card will slide free. Pick the wrong answer and the card is held in place. A very simple educational game, the math version of Teach Key Reading and Spelling.

Name: Barbie Just Us Girls
Description:
With a spin of the wheel, you must tell your secrets or take the challenge! Game makes childern act out or dance various Barbie scenerios, such as "Reciting a favorite Poem", Doing a 1 Minute Aerobic Routine, Changing Barbie's clothes in 30 Seconds or trying to do different dance routines. Try to Collect Cards w/Barbie Fashions, Cars & Other Accessories to Win! Sounds easy, right? However, a spink of the Barbie Wheel tells you if first you must tell a secret or perform a Barbie Challenge, such as Accepting an Award lik Superstar Barbie.

Components:

     random spinning wheel, 
     25 What To Wear cards, 
     25  Going In Style cards, 
     25 Places to Go cards, 
     5 Ken cards,

Name: Mystery Maze
Description: The Inscrutable Game of Skill and Luck. The object of the game is to guide all the marbles, one at a time, into the hole in the game center, and score the most points in each round

Name: Battaglia Aeronavale
Description: Typical game of Battleship that adds 3 planes, which have no particular special skills. Each player places two grids side by side. In the first grid, hidden by a screenplay depicting the world, he has to place his units, while in the second one he will place some chips showing the coordinates of the shots fired. The player who first hits all the enemy units wins.

Name: Superflash
Description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors. The game develops in 3 contests: the Curtain, where players in turn try to guess the character hidden by 16 tiles removing as few ones as possible, the Poll, where players try to guess the exact percentage of a national poll and the Big Quiz, where players try to answer a question on a exclusive selected subject between news, culture, science, show business, sport and advertising. Finally, each player has to answer to a question choosing between three different categories, namely music, history or literature/sport/show business, in order to double his own score or lose all the points scored. The player with the highest score, wins.

Name: Un Milione al Secondo
Description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors trying to answer questions on movie, music and sport subjects. The game develops in 2 phases. In the first phase, players collect points according to the difficulty of the trial by answering the questions or guessing the caricature of famous characters; in the second one, each player will have to answer to a number of questions on a subject chosen between movie, music and sport equal to the collected score divided by 3; for each correct answer, the player earns 3 millions £. The player who scores higher wins.

Name: Bug Out
Description:
The Speedy Scramble for Slugs and Bugs!

Bug Cards are scattered all over your table or even your living room floor! Players race to capture the bugs by covering each Bug Card with a matching Leaf Card--It's a wild scramble to find each bug! Be the first player to cover all of your matching Bug Cards and Bug Out!

Name: Sealed with a Kiss
Description: Sealed with a Kiss is a game where girls collect kisses (yes, kisses!) on their boyfriend's photos.  It works like this: Every player gets one of 12 boyfriend photos (these guys are hunks!). Anyway, put the photos in the frames and move around the game board collecting kisses.  When you win a kiss, you use the special 'kisser' stamper to stamp your boyfriend's photo.  But hey, life's not always great, is it?  Sometimes you can lose kisses, take kisses, or even have to trade boyfriends.  The first player to collect five kisses wins the game. It’s that easy and tons of fun!

Name: Transport: A Fascinating Card Game
Description:
60 cards, featuring Goods Cards, Conveyance Cards and Obstruction Cards.
It is a trick-taking game really, but quite advanced for its age. The first player in any round must offer a Goods Card. The next player may offer a Conveyance Card, suitable for carrying the Goods on offer. If he does, he collects the Goods Card. The third player may play an Obstruction to this arrangement and snaffle the Goods himself.
The winner is the player who collects the highest tonnage of Goods.

Name: Charge It!
Description:
The Crazy Credit Card Game!
Charge It! plays like real life. Big spenders bargain hunters and cash savers all have fun shopping and spending rolling the dice and moving around the board. Vacations, TVs and concert tickets are just a few of the possibilities to charge when players qualify for the Quik Charge, American Success, Recover and Bold Credit Cards.

Decide how to divide the payday cash between expenses, credit card debts or savings. Shoppers beware - it is easy to get caught in the alluring trap of unlimited purchasing power. Debts can pile up and the bank may revoke credit cards if payments are not made on time.

The object of Charge is to acquire the right combination of "paid up"  credit cards, purchased items and cash.  There may be some players who believe it is un-wise to have many credit cards.  Some may fail to get good credit.  These players may choose to win with one credit card, one purchased Item and $4,000 cash.  Can you guess how the other players will try to win?  Have fun!

Name: Dealer's Choice
Description:
Players lays the tiles on the gameboard playing:
Gin Rummy, Canasta, Poker, Fan Tan, Black Jack and Solitaire.
Some bonus squares in the game board are marked as cards and if players place the tile to any of this bonus squares they recieve high score.

Components:

     game board
     108 tiles, equal to two decks of cards, plus four jokers 
     4 tile racks.

Name: Ghoulash: Scenario Pack 3
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Features these three classic GHOULASH scenarios: "Now, Where Was I?" "Password" and "Pyramid Scheme".

SCENARIO: NOW, WHERE WAS I?

Warp zones keep you starting over time and again.

SCENARIO: PASSWORD

It's a Ghoul hunt! No, it's a word puzzle! No, it's both!

SCENARIO: PYRAMID SCHEME

No mummies in this pyramid, just plenty of Ghouls!

Name: Hot Shot Basketball
Description:
Based on the classic midway arcade game, the object of Hot Shot Basketball game is to either score the most points in 60 seconds or score 10 baskets in the least amount of time.  The game features switch positions and buttons on the backboard that give you lots of options to "put it up" for points!

You can choose between 2 skill levels and 2 games...and choose whether or not you want sound effects!

For 1 or more players.

Name: Springrings
Description:
From the box:
All You have to do is to put a ring on that funny little tin ring fixed to the ring and the press down the spring with Your finger and let it go suddenly. Up goes the ring and it falls on that pretty board with different colored divisions. If the ring falls into one of the 6 divisions it scores the number marked thereon. If You are lucky Your ring falls over the peg and then, You score the number of points marked in the centre. It is real fun to see who can score the highest number in a certain number of rounds.

Name: BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon
Description:
"BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon brings players a new and exciting way to jump into the BattleTech universe. As conflict erupts anew on the Lyran-Falcon border during the early years of the Jihad, two untested commands clash. Including the brief history and personal dossiers of the members of these two forces, this PDF provides scenarios and special rules compatible with BattleTech games using Total Warfare and A Time of War, complete with record sheets for their ’Mechs and characters alike."
- From www.classicbattletech.com

BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon presents a short campaign of linked missions for BattleTech.  One player plays the Kewran Wolfhounds, a company from the Lyran Alliance, while the other plays the Pursuing Peregrines, a binary from the Jade Falcons.  The player forces largely match up with the two packages of BattleForce-scale miniatures to be released by Iron Wind Metals in mid-2011.

Unlike BattleTech Starterbook: Sword and Dragon or BattleTech Starterbooks: Wolf and Blake, this product is a linear campaign.  This product does not use the Chaos Campaign rules or missions from other books - it only requires Total Warfare to play.

Name: Fastscore Baseball
Description:
Baseball simulation game, teams perform realistically.

From the publishers website:

A perfect complement to Replay Baseball for solo replay projects.  FastScore Baseball allows the Replayer to quickly play out a whole day's schedule of games, including realistic scores, in just minutes!

It's a quick play game that generates the score of a baseball game with a few rolls of the dice. The game incorporates ease of play, a simple ratings system and simple charts. Play to relax, no complicated mental gymnastics required.

Fastscore Baseball is played using two differently colored 6-sided dice. Each team has three ratings- an offensive, defensive and clutch rating. Better ratings are color coded in green while worse ratings are color coded in red. Higher offense ratings represent teams with punishing offenses. Lower defense ratings represent teams that give up fewer runs. Higher clutch ratings represent better team performance in close games.

If you play Fastscore as a stand-alone game, you can finish a season replay in a few hours! You can also use Fastscore Baseball as a complement to detailed, play by play games like Replay Baseball. If you are enjoying a single team replay, play your favorite team’s games with Replay while playing out the other games on the schedule with Fastscore, and see how your team is doing in the standings! A full day’s worth of games can be completed in a minute!

Fastscore offers great value for the gamer. Each Fastscore set includes multiple seasons for one low price! We Every season from 1950 to the current day is rated.

Each season includes:

    Scoring Charts
        One single-page chart
        One two-sided chart for two-page printing
        (same chart data, in two formats for printing) 
    
    Team Ratings Chart
    Starting Pitchers Ratings
    As-Played Schedule with starting pitchers and pre-calculated game ratings for each team

Name: Fastscore Football
Description:
From the publisher's website:

A perfect complement to Second Season Football for solo replay projects.  FastScore Football allows the Replayer to quickly play out a whole day's schedule of games, including realistic scores, in just minutes!

It's a quick play game that generates the score of a football game with a few rolls of the dice. It incorporates ease of play, a simple ratings system and simple charts. Hundreds of simulated seasons are run, ensuring the accuracy of each Fastscore season while factoring in each team’s strength of schedule.

Although the ratings seem simple, there is a great deal of background information packed into each rating. This game uniquely takes into account the offensive and defensive styles of each team by separating scoring frequency and scoring ability. For example, some teams may score frequently, but fail to execute in the red zone- thus adding points to the board with field goals more frequently than touchdowns. Others may rarely score but efficiently march into the endzone- thus scoring more touchdowns than field goals.   Additionally, offensive and defensive strengths in the running and passing game are reflected in the ratings and will influence the score of the game.  For example, teams with strong defenses against the run will more effectively shut down teams that rely on the running game.  And in close games, give your team a fighting chance by going for a 2-pt conversion!

With Fastscore football, teams will perform similarly to their real-life stats in points for and against, touchdowns for and against, field goals for and against, and most importantly, their win-loss record.  These stats are fine-tuned to a 250-season average typically within 10 points of actual, and within 2 TDs and FGs of actual.  Strength of schedule is factored into the ratings to ensure the utmost in accuracy.

And the best part: we’ve included the as-played schedule for each season! And we didn’t stop there- we know that your time is valuable, so we’ve calculated the final team ratings for each game on the schedule- taking into account home field advantage and the run/pass ratings- so you don’t have to do the calculations yourself.  Just sit back, roll the dice and mark down the score of the game.

Fastscore Football is played using two differently colored 6-sided dice. Each team has seven ratings representing offensive and defensive abilities and a clutch rating. Better ratings are color coded in green while worse ratings are color coded in red. Higher offense ratings represent teams with punishing offenses. Lower defense ratings represent teams that effectively shut down their opponents.

If you play Fastscore as a stand-alone game, you can finish a season replay in a few hours! You can also use Fastscore Football as a complement to detailed, play by play games like Second Season Football. If you are enjoying a single team replay, play your favorite team’s games with your favorite football game while playing out the other games on the schedule with Fastscore, and see how your team is doing in the standings! A week’s worth of games can be completed in less than 15 minutes!

Fastscore offers great value for the gamer. Each Fastscore set includes multiple seasons for one low price! We intend to rate every season from current day to the seasons of yesteryear.

Each season includes: 

    Rules of the game
    Scoring Charts
    Team Ratings Chart
    As-Played Schedule with pre-calculated game ratings for each team

Name: Armored Knights: Operation Gazelle
Description:
The Israeli offensive in Sinai / October 15 - October 24, 1973

Gazelle: Israel's most daring battle to cross the Suez Canal. General Sharon's Ugda (an Israeli Division) leads the offensive into Egypt and in a hard fought set of small fights ends up cutting off the Egyptian 3rd Army.

Armored Knights: Operation Gazelle the battle of the Israeli offensive to cross the Suez Canal and invade Africa and cut off the Egyptian Army elements that were on the east side of the canal. This game focuses on combat at the battalion level on a scale that makes representing large battles real fun. It will also have its own innovative and unique way to handle the combat mutlipliers for engineers, anti-tank, intelligence, and recon elements. The players will find this does not always work the way they want and the support troops sometimes fail to do the mission they are assigned to do. They might even have a detrimental effect.  Both players will be challenged from the start of the battle.  The Egyptians will find that counter-attacking is very difficult as the higher command did not beleive what they were told about the Israeli positions on the west bank of the Suez Canal.  The Israelis will find that getting across the canal is one thing, holding the crossing is another, and spreading out across the west bank is another still.  Players will be rewarded for mixing the different combat support elements to enhance each attack or defense.  As happened during the battle the Israelis will find it very hard to attack Egyptian infantry alone or against their anti-tank screens.  Six scenarios are available to play the whole battle through the cutting off of the Egyptian 3rd Army, or just some important parts dealing with the attacks on Ismailia or Suez City.

This game comes with:
    (8) 11x17 Color Map Sections
    (4) Color Order of Battle Cards
    Approximately 600 Die Cut Counters

(from publisher's website)

Name: Incredible Courage at Austerlitz: Telnitz
Description:
Incredible Courage at Austerlitz - Telnitz is GSI's first offering on Napoleonic warfare. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during the Battle of Austerlitz in December 1805.
The game features variable combat strengths. Turns are 10 minutes of time.   The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.  Unlike other games at this level the rules will not be massive.  Troop replacements are generated by returning stragglers to the battle.  A few features are variable combat strengths, elite units, and levels of order.  Units start with a certain amount of these and as they lose them their abilities are reduced.
Buxhowden came down off the Pratzen Heights to attack the French right since it was so weak.  Little did he know that while this was true at 0700 in the morning the Iron Marshall, Davout, would arrive shortly and provide the bulwark against which the defense would halt and then throw back the Coalition forces.

Similar to the Death Ride series this game is the first of many that wplayers will be able to build into a larger monster of the Austerlitz battle.  Again critical thinking will allow the players to figure out the correct formations and deployment of their troops.  Infantry units are modeled at the company level, cavalry at the squadron level, and artillery at the section level.  The rules for this detailed game will surprise you with their clarity and brevity.

Name: Death Ride Kursk: 11th Panzer
Description:
The game features the 11th Panzer Division and some supporting XLVIII Panzer Corps units at mostly Platoon and some Company/Battery level and the Red Army (31st Tank Corps, and other supporting elements) at Company/Battery level.

The combat system utilizes combat multipliers that players must use correctly to have the best effect. Each hex is 330 meters.  Turns are 2 hours long during the day and 4 hours at night.  The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn.  Unlike other games at this level the rules will not be massive. 

This system features extensive use of obstacles (mines, wire, improved positions, and fortifications), a patrol rule, overwatch fire, air and artillery support, and reserve movement.  These obstacles help channel the attack and force the Germans into kill sacks and forcing them to push through the heavy resistance to take ground.  Overwatch is a type of fire that allows the player to move a short distance and then setup to fire suppressive fire at enemy units that might otherwise use opportunity fire.  Reserve movement will allow a player to respond to enemy movement and move more units into a hex to strengthen it before an assault.  Units are modeled to represent the 2 major types of weapons that most units have.  Secondary (usually small arms) and a primary (main gun, machine guns, etc...). These weapons may fire at different targets if they want.  They also effect targets differently.   Suppression is also handled uniquely in this game.  Units that are suppressed get a defense bonus since they take better advantage of the terrain in the hex, while at the same time they have their other factors reduced.  Units are also modeled as needing transports and get the benefits of movement from them with the vulnerability that goes with it.  The battle follows the divisions actions during the 10 days of the battle.  

The amount of armor in this game is astonishing. Added to the other 2 games and it's tremendous. 11th Panzer has its 2 Infantry Regiments and supporting elements.  The game will also force players to account for Command and Control and Supply (expressed in a different way than the other games). Maintenance and repair are critical to both sides as this determines most of the replacements that arrive every morning.  Troop replacements are generated by returning casualties to the battle.  Lots of these casualties are minor in nature and both sides worked hard to get these wounded back to the front quickly.  Air-Ground Attack can have a significant effect on the battle and both sides have a capability in the air to affect the battle. 

The Germans were eventually bled white and forced to suspend Citadel.
The German attack starts facing only the soft crust and outposts the Red Army put in place to alert them of the assault's start.  The Germans have overwhelming numbers for this first phase of the battle and must utilize this advantage to make every kilometer of progress they can.  As the attack develops the Germans must generate fast movement through this area and break free into the tactical second echelon quickly to keep from getting bogged down.  The Soviets must use terrain and their considerable obstacles to slow down and stop the Germans in their tracks.  Stopping the Germans is going to be very hard.   The Germans will find their force attrited slowly but surely over time and the Red Army will be slaughtered in the first few days and then settle down to the grind that was the battle.

11th Panzer - comes with (in Full Color):

        (2) Map Sections of the Pena River Area of Operations (maps N3 & N4)
        Supplemental Rules Specific to 11th Panzer
        Order of Battle Cards
        Task Organization Charts for Each Major German and Red Army Formation
        Approximately 2000 Unit Counters and Markers

Name: All About Albany
Description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists.  The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Albany, NY depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards.  Businesses used this game as an advertisement.  Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

Name: The Web
Description:
Panic in the web! Two spider clans are fighting each other in an epic duel! Spiders in bigger groups will defeat the weakest in the intersections of the web.

A thrilling and challenging strategy game, where players attack and capture their opponent's spiders.

The goal is to capture three of your opponent's spiders. On each turn you can either place a spider on the board on one of the intersections of your color, or move a spider anywhere on the board onto an intersection of your color.  Spiders are captured when a spider is outnumbered orthogonally by spiders of the opposite color.

Name: ThriveTime for Teens
Description:
Players pick cards from the draw deck and make decisions based on the information given on each card. Document your decisions on your Game Sheet and move your Player Piece on the Board.

Some of the Choices You Will Make: Is it the right time to buy a car? How will I pay for college? Should I start a part time business?  Should I pay for those concert tickets with cash or use my credit card? etc.

Thrive Score measures the decisions you make in the game.
Good decisions = positive Thrive; poor decisions = negative Thrive. Everyone starts out with a zero Thrive Score (Survive).

You WIN if your Player who's game piece reaches Thrive first wins the game.

Name: Robin Hood Game
Description:
A fast-action race game for younger children, based on the lovable Walt Disney Robin Hood film characters.
A simple dice-rolling game. The object is to get your men safely to Nottingham Castle.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Crazy Caterpillar
Description: Colour and shape matching form the basis of this fun game as players compete to see who can make the l-o-n-g-e-s-t caterpillar (see image to see children playing the game). A spinner decides which card you may take and then you must try to fit it into your caterpillar.

Name: Topwords Kartenspiel
Description:
A card game where have to build a crossword puzzle.

The game contains 100 cards, each one as one or two letters printed on it. 4 cards are drawn and put on the table in a row. The rest of the cards are shuffled, divided by the players and put in front of them as individual stacks.

On your turn, you draw cards from your stack until you have 7 in your hand and try to add them to the existing words already on the table in a crossword puzzle style. You may cover existing cards (therefore the name of the game); only rows are required to be meaningful words, columns can be any letters you like.

If you manage to create a new word, you score the points according to its length and the next player takes his turn. The game ends when one player has only one or no more cards to play.

Name: plus3
Description:
Goal: Be the first who concentrates your meeples with a majority of 3 on one of the big yellow circuits

1. Each player places one of his/her coloured meeple on each big yellow circuit (16)
2. Move your meeples by turn along the small yellow circuits - jumping is not allowed; capacity on a small circuit: max 1 meeple; - on a big circuit: max 7 meeples
3. You win if the achieved majority is 3:0, 4:1 or 5:2

Name: Jäger und Füchse
Description:
Goal: Be the first who has captured 4 foxes

1  Hunters and foxes are placed on the tagged spaces of the board
2  Players roll the die by turn and try to catch a fox; you may move horizontal, vertical or 
    diagonal, but not in combination - excact number, jumping not allowed
3  Jump on the fox if you roll appropiate number
4  With appropiate number you may jump on an opponent's hunter if he carries one or more foxes 
    - he is sent back to his base immidiately
5  Foxes delivered to the base are safe

Name: Gefährliche Brücken
Description:
Goal: Be the first who fills up all 7 empty own target spaces

1. Each player places all meeples on his/her base
2. Roll the 2 dice by turns - with a '6' you have to put one of your meeples on the starting area
3. Move your meeple(s) by rolling the dice - you may use either one die or the other 
4. Catching an opponent => you aquired a prisoner you may use for to fill up your targets, too
5. Rolling a double you catch all meeples on a line (bridge) - you may choose - at once

Name: Times Seven: Creation
Description:
"Challenge your memory and test your luck as you race to collect seven Bible verses over seven rounds and win the game!
Learn what the Bible says about the creation as you lay down one completed verse per hand. Then discard key words from the verses to outscore your opponents. If you can't complete the verse before the round ends, you must try, try again!"

Each round, players attempt to collect a set of four numbered, color coded cards that complete a Bible verse. This is done by drafting and discarding. Once a complete verse has been collected the player then lays down their set and tries to go out as soon as possible by discarding their remaining cards on other players' sets. Keyword cards and other action cards add an extra twist to the gameplay. At the end of each round, points are 'awarded' based on remaining cards-in-hand, and after seven rounds the lowest scorer wins!

Name: Pirati All'Arrembaggio!
Description:
Pirati All'Arrembaggio! is a dexterity game in which you and up to three other captains manage your pirate crews and put those lazy marauders to work!

The objective of the game is to carefully place all your crew members (represented by four colors of mighty plastic pirates) on the correct colored level of the ship, determined by the random spin of a wheel. But be careful—the ship moves around a lot! If you cause any pirates to fall off of the ship, you have to take them into your crew, and try to get rid of them, too...

Only the best captain will get all of his crew on the ship and win the game.

"À l'abordage is a thrilling game of skill and balance for young and old alike, where anything goes. Your mission: Take over the boat by getting all your pirates on board!

This is not that simple, because the sea is raging and the boat is pitching about. Some pirates could well fall into the water.

To win, you need a little luck, but above all, a lot of skill!

Beware of the wheel of chance which has many surprises in store for you with its barrel of gun powder and its skull of death.

Be wary especially of your adversaries who are desperate to push you into a mistake.

If you overcome all the obstacles and place all your pirates on the boat first, you win.

Are you ready to take up this challenge and embark on the adventure?"

~translated from the box of the French version of the game

Name: City of Brass: a game of colonial exploration
Description:
from the introduction:
The Expedition Afrique

In 1892, the French led a military campaign in Dahomey, the "Slave  Coast" between Nigeria and Togo, against its kings so that they might  have control of Porto Novo, a coastal city. They marched all the way to  Abomey, the capital of the land, and found the rulers gone. They  amused themselves by looting the city for souvenirs. The French press  was most impressed by a white parasol decorated with human jawbones.

They never saw the inside of that parasol. Inside it was a map drawn  in human blood, a map that pointed to a legendary city deep in Afrca's interior. This city was called the City of Brass, a bastion of ancient  African civilization full of treasure, both gold and knowledge.

Sadi Carnot, the president of France, sent a expedition on that  doomed journey. It only took three weeks for them to become hopelessly lost in an uncharted land. To this day, no one knows what happened to them. According to legend, only one of them made it, and his  greatest wishes were given unto him.

In this game, you will play those lost souls. Trapped in Africa's interior, with a map drawn on a parasol and not enough resources, you  search.

A note about the content of this game

While there is no magic in this game, it is a fantasy. The nobility found  among the people of Africa is not balanced against the savagery found  here. Like all peoples, the historic Africans had both high nobility and  awful destruction found in them. Even though this game depicts the  negative side of culture disproportionally, the author is fully aware  that is not the only side, or even the dominant side.

User summary:
This game is a form of highly abstracted, limited scope role-playing game with a fixed set of characters and goals.

Each player takes one of 6 different pre-defined characters: the Explorer, the Official, the Doctor, the Priest, the Naturalist, and the Native Guide.  A minimum of 4 players is recommended and one player must play the Explorer.  The Explorer nominates the Leader and the Leader selects a Companion.  The Leader narrates the obstacles that face the expedition.

Each player must name their character (a French sounding name is recommended) and answer the question: what does your character seek in the City of Brass.

Each character has 6 predefined statistics and each Ability has a corresponding Resource that replenishes it . The Resources are drawn from a deck of resource cards during play.

The game is divided in 5 Acts, in each of the first four Acts there are 5 Obstacles.  The fifth act is the City of Brass and final scoring is done at the end of this act.

Points are scored by defeating the obstacles and players may help one another during play, but are free to refuse help.  Obstacles are defeated by rolling a pool of dice against the target set by the Leader for that obstacle.  The number of dice rolled is determined by the Ability that is required to defeat it.

Each player totals their Quest Points earned during play and plays out the endgame story.  The endgame has a blind voting/bluff mechanism that offers a point bonus based on player voting, bluffing is possible during the vote count.

At the end of play, the player with the most points is the winner.  Ties are possible.

Name: Jokk
Description:
Jokk means "all is correct in legally" in Estonia.

There are a 101 colored spaces in gameboard where players move.from 1 to 101.
1-40 spaces are for local level
41-82 spaces are for state level
83-100 spaces are for upper class level

In his turn player roll the die, move his pawn and draw a card same color as space he stands. Different colors mean different categories of questions: Varia, Local, State, Internatinal, President. Player who answer correctly gives 1 point. Wrong answer gives -1 point.
Player may move to next higer level if he has at least 5 points to give or he must take another round to get more points.
Player who reach first in 101th "Jokk" area wins the game.

Name: Littleroller; Phantom Capsule
Description:
A Rules-light Print'n'play tabletop strategy game for 1 or more players, Phantom Capsule revolves around piloting middle-sized robots in defense of a city plagued by monsters.
The game pieces are all constructable papercrafts.
All game-pieces and rules are free and available for download.

Gameplay centers around logistics, in that players decide what to focus their robot's precious energy on before the actual action phase begins.
The monsters operate on rudimentary AI, and largely govern themselves.

The goal of each mission is variable, but typically the player/players must work together to defend a single power plant from invaders. There are also rules for direct competition between players, which gets messy very quickly.

Name: Junior Couch Potato Game
Description: A cartoon-watching game designed to teach children to observe carefully while watching TV. Kids search each cartoon for a series of objects or characters shown on their hand of playing cards or on the game board. The first to spot them all is the winner.

Name: Apostles
Description:
Apostles is a card game for 2-4 players.  Players compete to be the first to play out their entire hand of cards in numerical order, while alternating colors, onto any of the four starting piles.  Simon/Peter(#1) cards can start new piles in the corners of the gameplay area.  Based on the classic game "King's Corners", Apostles is a fun way to learn about the 12 Apostles.

Great for Sunday Schools, Youth Groups and Family Game Nights.  Part of the Sporadic Games Educational Line.

Name: Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels
Description:
Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels is a light economic game simulating supply and demand in the fair trade market. Players make contracts with growers, sell coffee to their market, and improve their operation in order to satisfy the cravings of addicts the world over.

On each turn a player does the following:

1) Draw three coffee cubes from a bag containing equal amounts of coffee cubes. Add them to the demand meters in the center of the board.
2) "Make contracts" with growers from the four corners of the world by moving each grower marker up or down on the contract grid in front of you.
3) The growers then grow coffee. Each player draws one cube for each region he/she has contracts with. The amount of contracts made for that region as well as the type of cube drawn determines how much coffee you get.
4) The player has the option to advertise specific types of coffee, thus potential increasing demand for their stock.
5) Players then may sell their coffee, making more for coffees in higher demand. Selling coffee reduces demand for that coffee in their region.

Because there is a set amount of cubes in the bag, players must balance supply and demand to stay on top.

Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels is the first in a line of "Green" games by I-55 Games (a non-profit publisher aimed to provide workplace re-entry training in St. Louis).  These games are all hand manufactured and made with almost entirely re-purposed material.

Name: Arrr!
Description: Arrr! is a semi-cooperative pirate game where the players control pirates on a ship and try to board the enemy, get treasures and gold and don't get sunk. Internal struggles forces munitys and backstabbing but the players can only survive as a team. If the ship sinks, all players lost, if the game ends, the player with the most gold in his treasurechest wins.

Name: Auction Junktion
Description:
Auction Junktion is a storage auction game in which the players use auction, bluffing and other underhanded skills to win the best treasures while leaving everyone else wallowing in useless junk!

When storage lockers go unpaid or abandoned, the property goes up for auction to the highest bidder!

Each auction is played out with several face down cards drawn representing items in a storage locker. Each player only gets to peek at one item but you are bidding on the entire set. Be careful, because many of the items are worthless junk! Sift your way through the trash to find the hidden treasures!

You’ve got to use all the bargaining skills you have to beat out the competition as well as good bluffing skills to get the other players to buy all the junk.

It’s all about the money; will you have it all at the end or will you be wallowing in a big pile of junk?

(NOTE: This game does not intend to depict real world prices for items found in storage units. This game is for entertainment purposes only.)

Name: Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe
Description: Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe is a game that is about investing in combinations of the most profitable companies to earn the most money.  The game models the westward expansion of railroads from the East Coast all the way to the Pacific.  Players begin with a set number of cubes which they can choose to invest as shares, expand railroad networks, add to the value of resources or add resources to railroads.  Like colors for railroads doubles income at railroad stops.  Each railroad has a varied amount of stops and resource combinations to ensure that every game is different.  When two adjacent starting railroads have fully developed their routes, the second stage of railroads opens up and dividends are issued to the first and second majority owners matching that company color.  The game progresses until all players pass or there are no more valid moves to be made.  A final dividend is triggered and the player with the most money wins.

Name: Conquest
Description: Use your armies wisely and conquer the world!. A dice rolling combat based wargame, in which you place your armies in different places of the world map and fight the other players over total domination. In essence, a risk clone.

Name: Edelsteinsuche
Description:
Each player tries to complete a row of five numbered cards with one kind of precious stone. 
There are four kinds of stones. Each player secretly has a kind of stone that s/he collects, and a row of five face-down cards in front of him/her. In a turn, a player takes a card from another player and looks at it. If it is the kind of stone s/je is looking for, s/he places the card face-down in front of him/her (in the right position, 1-5). If it is a different kind of stone, the card can go to any of the other positions. In any case the card that was in that position before goes to the position of the card that was drawn. 
A player who reveals what kind of stone s/he is looking for gets two bonus moves. 
The first player to complete the row of five cards of his/her preferred kind in the right order is the winner.

The game was published in WIN - Das Spielejournal 418 in January 2011.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Dodgem
Description:
There is no date on the rules but the style of the graphics and shape of the vehicles suggest post 1945 and likely to be in the early 1950's.

The mechanics of the game is similar in style to ludo/pachisi but involves moving both a pedestrian and a vehicle from Home to Base to win.  The four routes around the board intercept each other.   The pedestrian dodge the motorists to avoid being knocked down and sent to hospital. The vehicles avoid the pedestrians as well as the police car to avoid being sent to prison.

A die is thrown and as you move along your route you hope to avoid landing on the many penalty square which may throw you into the path of other players' vehicles or pedestrians

Every time a 6 is thrown the police car is moved to try and catch jaywalkers and cars

Name: Secret City
Description:
Per the back of the box

Based on the bestselling novels by Vadim Panov. Fairytales and chilling nightmares have become reality on the streets of Moscow. Take control over on of the Secret City's Great Houses and embark on the path of fights and intrigue! Conquer enemy territories, assemble armies, purchase mysterious artifacts, cast deadly spells and summon the greatest heroes of your House to aid you in your quest to assume total control over the Secret City.

Secret City is based on the eponymous series of books by Vadim Panov and tells the story of another Moscow, home to the last representatives of long lost civilizations, and in particular - of the three Great houses of powerful magicians: Chud', Lud' and Nav'.

The game, designed for 2-6 people and is built on the hard opposition players to each other. Diplomacy in the Regulations allows to conclude temporary alliances, but this only exacerbates the depth of conflict, because to win the struggle can only one Great House.

Secret City is a tactical and strategic game where the player must correctly distribute profits from the territories, buying the best mercenary, and accumulating magic energy for powerful spells. The basis of the gameplay are the Strategy - a special announcement at the beginning of the map, whose success depends on the player's army, spells that are on his hands and, of course, the actions of other participants.

Name: Bull's-eye
Description:
From the game's website: The first player to the 100-point target wins.  Each round all players get 7 new letter cards. A die is rolled to determine the length of the word that will score points in that round. (Ex. If a 4 is rolled, only 4-letter words score points that round.) Roll a bull’s-eye, and the roller gets to determine that round’s word length.

Each letter card has a value attached to it. Some special letter cards have a range of values (Ex. 0 - 2) where a player gets to choose the value (0, 1 or 2) if that card can be used in a word. Playing at the same time, using their own cards, players have one minute to make a word of the determined length for that round.

At the end of each round, players advance their tokens by the number of points in the word they made, starting with the player who rolled the die. Choose carefully. Your highest-scoring word isn’t always your best choice. There are consequence targets on the board (red - always beneficial; black - take a chance) that can help you get to the final goal fastest.  Land on a target - take the consequence.  Making the best use of these targets is the key to winning.

Name: Palette
Description: A player has five seconds to memorize a specific shade of color. He then tries to match it to the same color on one of the color wheels. The first player to make six matches wins.

Name: Volcanic Disaster
Description: This is a rummy-style game. Players play from and then replenish their hands of cards. The goal is to be the first player to play five volcano cards. You obtain and play a volcano card when you discard three different precursor cards from your hand simultaneously. Meanwhile, various action cards played by you and the other players can help or hinder your progress.

Name: Gamate
Description:
This game is for 4 players, playing as partners.

Each card has a value from 1 to 48. The four Aces are excluded from this and are called Muettes (the French word for Mute). Each player can bid which is really a search for a trump sequence. An example of bidding could be 'All the red cards' or '7s to 9s'. The only restriction in the bidding is that a legal bid must be at least 2 cards and no more than 24 cards. Once established, the hand is played. Note that there is no following suit, you can play any card in your hand to a trick and that the partnership, that won the bid, can nominate that each trick will be played High or Low (all tricks will be won by the highest ranked card or that each trick will be won by the lowest ranked card).
I understand that one year after the release of the game, the author published a revised set of rules which customers could collect at their Parisian game's shop.

Name: Evolution: Time to Fly
Description:
Evolution never stops at one place. In Evolution: The Origin of Species you created toxic predators, hid them in holes, and built compound chains of interactions. Your animals accumulated fatty stock, ran into hibernation, and rejected tails.

The Evolution: Time to Fly expansion opens new space for experimentation and change. Now you can hide your animals in strong shells, teach them to emit ink, and (as the title suggests) take to the skies. With ever-increasing change in the animal kingdom, you might think twice before attacking a harmless animal as it might not be defenseless prey, but rather a dangerous predator using itself as bait to catch you.

Evolution: The Origin of Species allowed players to create more than 50,000 different animals; with Evolution: Time to Fly, the number of possible combinations tops 50 million – more than the number of kinds of living animals on Earth.

Name: Prawda czy Wyzwanie
Description:
PRAWDA CZY WYZWANIE (TRUTH OR DARE) is one of the most popular party games ever. Its prototype consisted of bottle gaming, and challenging or asking chosen players some kind of embarrassing questions.

 
In the card version of the game the players finally have a possibility to choose the task, and a random person who decides to speak the truth or take the challenge. They may choose from a pool of over 300 questions and over 100 challenges presented on the cards. The game also allows some space for inventing your own questions.
 Extra rules and an option of a reward for the winner makes the game dynamic and exciting! Additional tasks and duels make the game even more fun. Another thing is the special cards which you can shuffle into the main deck. They give you the possiblity of changing the questions, or even asking players about the details of their previous answers, or force everyone in a current round to take a challenge!

Name: UNO Reflex
Description: UNO Reflex Game: UNO reflex brings fast, fun action to the classic game of UNO. Race to match the colored light one of two ways: in Reflex mode, race to play the color first, in Wild mode use your skills to select the color you want. Includes the electronic UNO Reflex unit, 108 cards and instructions. For 2 to 10 players.

Name: Kabal
Description:
Theme: Approaching the Apocalypse, the various factions of the occult world accelerate their struggles to achieve their  ancestors goals.
 The Nephilim are waking up in mass and prepare to return to their previous state of mind magic ... The Templars organized to implement the Grand Plan and declare war on the Nephilim and Selenim.
 The Selenim leave their kingdoms, these  extraterrestrials dimensionsthey are the masters, and work vigorously for the recreation of the Black Moon and the advent of a dark age that one can bring the Apocalypse.
 The Mysteries, the occult societies, born when the world was young and when the Nephilim were running free all over the world, leave the shadows and confront the other factions at the approach of the Apocalypse.
 The time has come!

Goal: 
You win the game, either by obtaining the number of victory points defined early in the game, either by eliminating all the bases or opponents without having the opportunity to put new bases in game on the next turn.
 Once the game starts, the victory points are obtained in two ways:
 Each opponent base destroyed gives 1 victory point .
 A successful mission saves 2 to 5 points of victory, according to its difficulty.
 Once fixed the number of victory points , the game can begin ...
Game play: the first stage of the game is to place a base on the table. This base will be the starting point for the operations of your characters. once it's done, you may put characters in play, and they will act thereafter.  Your network grows by the involvement of new bases that will cause more characters.
 Once brought into play, a character can take action. Thus, we can equip, prepare magical operations, playing a special action card, be a ship for a mission or a mission to intercept enemy, etc..

Name: Fancy Nancy Going Places Game
Description:
Visit all of Fancy Nancy's favorite spots, collecting Souvenir Tokens as you go. When your luggage is covered with mementos of where you've been, race home as fast as you can. The first one home is the winner.

Encourages simple decision making and strategic thinking; visual interpretation and social skills.

Game contains 1 Board, 1 Spinner, 4 Fancy Nancy Game Pieces, 4 Suitcase Boards, and 16 Souvenir Tokens.

Age 5 and up.

Name: Force of Fiction
Description: 2-4 players take turns influencing a central character in an attempt to end each chapter of her life to their advantage.  The several mechanics that drive the game; playing color-based scenery cards in connection to her location, drawing tokens with positive or negative words on them, and taking 'characterized' actions -will all be used by the players to tell the story as it happens.  Whichever player's decisions had the strongest influence on the story, wins!

Name: Nova's Ark
Description:
Nova was a sentient alien scientist, and he had made a startling, grave discovery; the galaxy he had called home was also home to an imminent supernova, about to wipe out life as they knew it. Many of the animals in the galaxy were not sentient; they would have no way of surviving on their own. So he established a team for the preservation of alien life. Jumping from planet to planet in a race against a star about to explode, they sought to gather these aliens into a space vehicle that could carry them all to safety. They called it Nova’s Ark…

This is a light cooperative game for 2-7 players which plays in about 15-20 minutes; it also features a solitaire variant.

There are 72 cards in the deck in sets of 2, 3, 4 or 5; a player starts his turn by drawing a set of cards equal to the number of players. This player chooses a card, and passes the cards around the table, so that there are a dwindling number of choices. As players collect sets, these are played in to clear space in a player's hand. Each player has a hand-limit of 5 cards. If any player exceeds the number of cards he can hold, the team is defeated. If all 72 cards are either held (without exceeding hand-limit) or presented in sets, all players win.

MICROBADGE NOW ABAILABLE!
 Nova's Ark Fan

Name: Captain's Log #10
Description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Special Tactics Issue

Featured Scenarios: The Orions engage in a tractor pull over an alien derelict. The scout Crockett duels with a Romulan Frigate. Romulan fighters attack a Gorn squadron. Klingon PFs track a Federation saucer. Klingon and Kzinti squadrons battle in an Ion Storm. The Coalition and Alliance battle in the last stages of Operation Cavalry.

Also features: Tactics, New Hydran SSDs, Federation & Empire Q&A, Fiction, info on Doomsday edition of SFB, & a preview of the Prime Directive RPG.

Name: Captain's Log #11
Description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Origins of the General War!

Featured Scenarios: Kzinti and Lyran cruisers square off in Cold Front. Orions rescue Hamilcar's son from the Klingons. WYN and Kzinti frigates battle on the edge of the radiation zone. Klingons ambush two Fed cruisers, and discovers on is a CX! Two Gorn X-ships pursue a Romulan ThunderHawk. An ISC squadron pursues the Hydrans into the rings.

Also includes... Cold Front (a history of the Coalition, the Kzintis, & the Hydrans); Universe (information about Doomsday edition & Prime Directive RPG); Tactics; Federation & Empire Q&A; two new X-Ship SSDs; and more.

Name: Boy Crazy
Description:
Boy Crazy is a simple collectible card game for girls, created by Decipher Inc. during the Pokémon Trading Card Game boom.

Cards are distributed in packs of 9 cards. Each card featured a picture of a boy aged 12–22, his first name, set of statistics about him (height, date of birth, color of eyes), and a list of his likes and dislikes. Cards includes boys from across the United States, from different ethnic backgrounds and hair and eye colors, including disabled boys.

Game is basically a very simple matchmaking game. Minimum requirements for game are at least 9 cards, and each player should have pencil and paper. Play begins when players decide who gets to go first. Using the Boy Crazy cards (9 cards or more), first player secretly writes down which boy she likes best and why. Then the first player lays out the cards so everyone can see them. The other players try to make a match by writing who they think is the best boy for the first player and why. Then, each of the other players take turns revealing who they chose as her match. After the first player reveals her response, scores are tabulated for that round. Each player who correctly matches the first player's response scores a point. Play continues until every girl has a chance for her friends to guess her match. To start a new round players should discard starting set of 9 cards and draw a new set of 9 cards. The player or players who makes the most correct guesses wins.

The game was so popular that Decipher launched a companion "Boy Crazy" magazine in September 2001.

Name: Road to Baghdad: Iraq 2003
Description:
From the back of the cover:

Road to Baghdad gives Force on Force: Modern Wargaming Rules players all the information they need to re-fight the 2003 Allied Invasion of Iraq. From deadly little firefights between Iraqi Fedayeen and US Special Forces to armored strikes against Republican Guard positions across the Tigris River, Road to Baghdad offers a wealth of varied scenarios and mission objectives that will challenge the tactical abilities of new and experienced wargamers alike. With a wealth of new information to expand Force on Force: Modern Wargaming Rules, including detailed historical background and orders of battle for US, British, and Iraqi forces during the invasion, Road to baghdad allows players to really get to grips with the experience of war in the opening stages of Operation Iraqi Freedom.

Name: Big Fish Little Fish
Description:
A trick-taking game for traditional playing cards. Features 'boasting' - a push-your-luck mechanic.

Each round, an auction is held for the right to be 'big fish', who will have a better hand and should win more tricks than any little fish. Unlike other card games, you bid points of your score - being a big fish carries a greater element of risk, since you need to regain at least the points you just lost in the auction.

A game lasts around 4-6 rounds, decided in advance. For 2 players, 4 rounds are recommended.

summary of a round:
- DEAL 6 cards to each player. Deal out a face-up 'dummy hand' of 6 cards.

- Have an AUCTION for the right to be big fish. The winning bid is deducted from the big fish's score.

- BIG FISH declares the trump suit, then exchanges any number of cards from their hand with cards from the extra hand.

- Each player BOASTS how many tricks they will win.

- Starting with Big Fish, PLAY out the 6 tricks. There is no need to follow suit and the first-played suit has no special significance.

- Players who took fewer tricks than their boast win nothing. Players who win at least as many as their boast SCORE points equal to their boast squared.

Name: Outrider: Dealin' Damage
Description:
Dealin' Damage adds a new level of detail to Outrider's damage track. Instead of just losing Armor Tokens, players can lose something crucial with each hit suffered. Tires blowout, engines sputter and stall, weapons jam and ultimately fail and your armor could shear off - taking parts of your car with it! Even the vehicle's driver isn't safe: one bullet could injure or outright kill the driver. 
  
The Dealin' Damage Bolt-On contains rules, damage cards, targeted damage cards, critical effect cards as well as a set of smoke and debris markers to enhance gameplay.

Name: Four in a Row 3D
Description: Four in a Row 3D! is a great two player game where both players try to make four in a row with their rings (one color for each of them). The first one to get four identical color beads in a row wins. This game is the same as the classic four in a row game except this time it is back in a new 3D form, 4x4x4 grid to add a new edge to the game. There is also an 5x5x5 version (see picture).

Name: Red Sun
Description: This puzzle puts brain versus brain in the spot light. All around the red sun! In this game, two players must face off with each other. Each gets two pegs to use. Players take turn moving a peg from one of the holes to the other. The first player to make it so the other cannot move loses and will not get the glory of the red sun! It is a think quick act quick game. The rules do not allow for time to think and strategize. You must be on your toes and always think one step ahead!

Name: Anima Tactics: Alis Testarossa
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Member of the prestigious Testarossa dynasty, one the most influential noble houses of Argos, the rebellious and stubborn Alis was always the source of problems for all her family because of her impetuous behaviour. When she was thirteen Alis began to manifest supernatural talents. Her parents, fearful of Alis bringing shame to the family, used their influence to send her to the church. There, Alis developed her skills under the supervision of the Knights of the Saint Order. When she was only 21 obtained the title of High Captain in recognition of her extraordinary abilities.

Thanks to her control over energy and her capability to manifest wings of light and soar upon the skies, she has become a legend of the Knights of the Saint Order, and some see her as a angel sent by heaven.

Warrior - Church - Level 40

Wings of Light: If Alis sacrifices 3 LP during the Maintenance Phase, she obtains the Flying skill during the rest of the turn.

Valkyrie (Ki, Charte) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage Alis must be Flying.

Aegis' Wind (Ki, Movement, Escape) - Alis automatically escapes Hand-to-Hand combat and may move up to 12 inches.  This does not count as movement for the current turn.  She may not engage in hand-to-hand combat using this movement action.  Alis must be Flying.

Aegis (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage.  If the attack causes damage, retire all Positive States from the enemy unit.

Beyond the Winds (KI, Charge) - Retire Alis from the board.  During her activation in the following turn, place her in contact with any enemy unit in game and complete the Charge.  Alis returns to the board with 0 action points.  Alis must be Flying in the moment she uses this skill.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Clover Leap
Description:
Players herd their sheep around the board to collect Clover Tiles and also score bonus points for completing sentences.  This game teaches children educational skills such as forming basic sentences and completing sets.  The game play involves light strategy and also allows children to practice early reading and simple math.

Publisher's Description:
A Grammar Game Your Family will Flock To

Collect the clovers with your sheep to form sentences. Score with each subject, verb, adjective, and object. You’ll laugh at the wacky sentences you create!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Early Vocabulary, Strategy, Basic Sentence Structure

Name: Anima Tactics: Janiel
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Few agents of Samael have proven as useful to the organization as the Sylvain Janiel Ul Del Valiem. Young even by the standards of her race, Janiel is both an incomparable spell caster and an unequaled martial artist in the service of the Fallen Angel Dinah. Her mystical abilities allow her to invoke into the world a guardian spirit named Enjeil, who takes the form of an enormous eagle made of energy, through which she manifests her powers. Any obscure power that underestimates her will meet its end in a flurry of feathers.

Warrior / Mystic - Samael - Level 40

Einjeil Eyes (Magic, Seek) - This ability gives +8 inches to Janiel's Control Zone and +1 to the success roll of the Seek Control.

The Mark of Einjeil (Magic, Effect) - Choose an enemy unit within 20 inches.  Until the end of the turn, all Ranged Attacks of any friendly unit against that enemy gain +2 Attack.  Effect 16.

Feathers Storm (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (20 Inches), +2 Damage.

Feathers Slash (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage.

Healing Breath (Magic, Effect) - A friendly unit inside Janiel's Control Zone gains Lv 2 Healing.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Name: Wizkids DVD board game
Description:
From the publisher:
Wizkids is the DVD board game that teases your brain. Wizkids is about science and technology with bizarre trivia and experiments. Wizkids is fast, explosive, varied and enormously interesting.

Challenge each other in five different categories and train your brain. The DVD gives you and your fellow players directions in the form of films, photos and animations about the most unusual subjects. With more than 800 extraordinary trivia!

Do you have the brains of a prawn or are you much smarter that the rest? Do you know more? Can you calculate faster, draw better and remember or recognize more? than you will certainly win the game!

Name: minifig World: BATTLELINES
Description:
BATTLELINES is a collectible card game based on LEGO miniatures. However using miniatures is not required for game play.

Each Character card represents a miniature of miniFig World. Other cards types include Equipment and Weapons.

The game play is simple and battles are resolved with a dice D6. It is a 2 player game, with a customizable deck.
 BATTLELINES uses a unique system to keep track of Characters Ammo and Health using LEGO studs attached to each Character card.

Legendary miniFig Characters like "Brodie SARGE Munro" battle against each other using their Power (PWR) and Defence (DEF) and whatever Equipment or Weapons are available to beat their opponents.

miniFig World is an Australian based internet business which specialises in LEGO miniatures and accessories.

Name: Little Noddy Car Game
Description:
A simple race game from the early 50's. Players are trying to get to the Station first. Throw a die and move. You must obey the instructions on the square that you land on. For example, A Flat Tyre on space 44, which makes you go back to 33. Or a Green Traffic Light on space 16, which means you can quickly proceed to 21.
Traditional rules such as 'Have another turn if you throw a 6' and 'You need the exact throw to finish'.
A nice touch is the provision of a box to keep your pieces in. The pieces are 4 cars and a die.

Name: Hoksotin
Description:
Hoksotin is a game where you spin a Twister-type spinner, that tells you what you'll need to find from the board, for example you'll have to find "Something round". In limited time you'll try and find as many round things as possible, marking the ones you already found with sticky little chips in you color. When the time runs out the chips are removed and correct ones are scored on your personal scoreboard. The one that gets most points in the limited number of rounds is the winner. There are 3 different two-sided boards with the art that is very appealing to the children.

Hoksotin was one of the finalists in the "Vuoden perhepeli 2010" -competion. (The Best Family Game of 2010).

Name: Daredevil Smith
Description:
A game which starts the same way but then the board tiles shift and each game is now unique.
'For 2 to 4 Adventurers' say the rules. You are dealt 3 room Cards and it is your objective to 'dynamite' each room so named. If you do this first and exit the board, you win. Each tile has a two digit number. You roll the dice to move and you must move the full throw (if you can't, you forfeit the throw) and you are allowed to change direction once. After moving, you check the pips on both dice, and this will relate to two tiles. Example; You roll a 5 and a 3, this will relate to tile 53 or tile 35, your choice. If you roll doubles, only one tile will be available. The tile you choose is picked up and placed somewhere else. It can be anyway round and it must be adjacent to an existing tile.There are special tiles in the game, for example, the Start tile or The Misty Mists tile.

Name: Zuniq
Description:
Zuniq is an abstract game for two players, played in an 8x8 grid of evenly spaced dots.
Players take turns joining two horizontally or vertically adjacent dots by a segment. Eventually, closed zones will form. It’s irrelevant which player closes which zone; zones do not belong to any player.

There are only two restrictions:
- Once closed, zones are out of bounds for the players. They cannot move in its interior anymore.
- There can never be zones of the same size.
Zuniq’s goal is simple: to be the last player able to move. The player who cannot make a move (either because there are none possible or because it would make a zone with repeated size) is the loser. Draws are impossible.

Name: Buggy
Description: Simple race game with the objective of being first to win the Rally.The pieces are nice, small cars (the Buggies in the title).

Name: Europa im Jet
Description: Educational game for children. They fly across Europe and learn a little geography. The winner is the first player who has visited the airports and also answer a question about each city.

Name: Bratz: All Out Card Game
Description:
There are two ways to win ALL OUT - EITHER be the first to get rid of all your cards, OR be the first to collect a set of ten cards with matching icons.

Players collect sets of 3-10 character cards with the same icon. In his turn player plays set in front of him face up or add card with a matching icon to any set already on the table. 
Player may also play an event card.

Player who gets rid of all your cards or has a set of 10 matching cards on the table in front of him must shout "ALL OUT!!!". He is the winner.

Name: Destination: Rain Forest
Description:
This is an educational game to help with speech and communication skills using a rain forest theme.

A Game of Syntax, Morphology, and Phonology.

Contents include:
- Rain forest gameboard
- 5 card decks
- 21 token cards
- 7 token boards
- 4 playing pieces

There are 2 versions included in the rules:
- 1: secure more token cards than any other player.  You receive a token card when you land on the "Explore the rain forest" square and answer a question correctly.
- 2: be the first to secure the three specific tokens that correspond to the token board held by the player.  You do this by landing on a desired space that matches a space on your token board and correctly answer a question.

Name: Ja, See? Express
Description:
Ja, See? Express is a free Print & Play game that is inspired by older, more traditional dice-rolling games, but distills the rules down into only the most critical and exciting elements. This allows for a quicker and easier game, while still retaining all of the edge-of-the-seat dice-rolling thrills that players love.

In turn, players roll five dice and may choose to keep their results, or re-roll any number of dice up to two additional times, while trying to make the highest point-scoring combination of die results. At the end of their turn, players record their score on the custom score pad, and play proceeds to the next player. Play continues in this manner until all players have filled their score sheet, or until one player has scored 50 points. The first player to 50 points is the winner.

This version of the ruleset also includes bonus rules for Ja, See? Express Express, the fastest and most exciting way to play Ja, See? Express yet devised.

A PDF file containing the rules and components is now available in the Files section.

Name: Hank's Golf Resort
Description:
Hank Powerman’s dream was to run the perfect golf resort.  He’d just won the one million dollar lottery; problem is, he doesn’t know how to design one.  That’s where you come in.  Hank will hire you to design the world’s greatest golf course.

In this unique card game, players must build a golf course by buying holes, and amenities (IE Pro Shop, Pool area, etc.), then using your "Fore!" cards that you were dealt with in the beginning of the game, by constructing your course, laying down the cards on the table making sure the cart path connects with each other.  Continue to lay the cards until you have all 18 holes on your course, but beware your opponents can sabotage your course with gophers and floods.  Don't forget, you also need employees to help you run Hank's Resort to help you combat your opponent's disasters.

"Its a game that's Par for the Course!"

Name: Advance the Colors
Description:
User summary:
Advance The Colors is the first widely-published set of 1:1 ratio rules to cover the American Civil War. The rules focus on simulating tactical and skirmish-level engagements between company or regimental-sized units with an ideal size limit of between 200-300 figures per side. Each miniature represents a single soldier or artillery piece and the rules provide for officer ranks, command and control, and campaign development of individual soldiers through heroic actions. The rules we're written primarly for 15mm miniatures but can easily be used with 5mm-25mm.

Name: A Giant Game Sheet of Star Wars
Description: An 87cm x 61cm board,featuring various routes across the galaxy, from The Rebel Alliance start area and ending at theImperial Starship Battle Station Death Star. Players roll dice to advance along one of the routes, taking detours where indicated. The first player to reach the Death Star wins the game. The publisher claims this is an official adaption of the Twentieth Century Fox Film.

Name: Roll Around
Description:
This is a handheld action/skill game. By tilting and rotating the tube, try to maneuver the ball around the inside track. It's tricky but FUN for the whole family! The perfect score is 23, achieved by moving the ball back and forth across the track 4 times.

Components:

     Roll Around game unit, 
     two steel balls

Name: Captain's Log #13
Description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Best of Nexus
The best of the classic NEXUS files, completely revised and updated for the Captain's Edition!

Featured Scenarios & Items: Complete rules for the ISC (including Order of Battle, Counters, and rules) published here for the first time! Federation & Empire tactic notes & combat missions. Scenarios: The Hydran Expedition and The Second Federation-Kzinti War.

Also includes: Klingon Battlecruisers (four previously unpublished SSDs); Tactics; and Academy (the Commander and his cadets discuss classic SFB strategy & maneuvers).

Name: Captain's Log #15
Description:
User Summary

Too Close to the Flame

Featured Scenarios: Kzintis battle Lyrans, but they are all 'Too Close to the Flame. Klingons trap a Federation Battlecruiser with Betrayal at Oxvind V. The Masters force captive starships to play the cruel game of PhaserTag. The ISC tries to stop a war, but Accursed are the Peacemakers. Face a deadly solitaire challenge in Spinner's Moon. Play in a 500-point Squadron Tournament!

Also Included: Various extras & updates for Federation & Empire; SFB Universe Timeline; Tactics; and Four New Tournament Ships w/ SSDs.

Name: Captain's Log #16
Description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

A Sense of Obligation

Featured Scenarios: Stop the Jindarians! Rescue hostages from Tholian space. Intercept a convoy! There's a Q-ship inside your convoy. Take a Federation Mauler into a Nest of Andromedan Vipers! Hunt down the Klingon mauler Siegebreaker. Tackle a new monster: the Mulakee. Rescue a Convoy from a zone where it's Hotter than Blazes. X-ships meet in a Slugfest.

Also included: The Frax (16 pages of new SSDs); Eight New Ships (8 additional SSDs); Index (of all elements in the SFB Universe); More Federation & Empire info; and more

Name: Coffee Talk
Description:
The Joy of Conversation Game

Turn over a “Topic Card” and then everyone has 45 seconds to write down whatever they can think of about in relation to the topic; topics range from New York City to Jay Leno to Google to Las Vegas.  When time is up, players move their coffee beans up their respective containers (boards) based on the number of original ideas they had.  To change a topic:  “Cream it” and move on.  To have the other players to accept your offbeat answers:  Sweeten them up with a “Sugar Packet”... and you score.

Contents:  300 topics, 10 Instant Coffee Cards, 12 Sugar Packets, 12 Creamer Packets, 6 Coffee Beans, 6 Individual  Coffee Cup Scoring Boards, 6 Score Pads and a 45 second Sand Timer.

Name: Gumption
Description:
The game board shows the economic resources of eight iconic kiwi organizations. Each player is in a race to own these resources. To win, a player needs to own all the resources (natural, human and capital) of two organizations. The first player to do this is the winner.

Players gain resources by either landing on an unowned resource and buying it from the bank or by trading with other players. The enterprising nature of Gumption is encouraged by deal-breaking squares on the game board and by risk cards. The playing pieces are familiar New Zealand icons which players use to move around the game board.

The game comes with a booklet that highlights each of the organizations depicted on the board.

Each denomination of the money used in Gumption profiles an invention that has started a New Zealand business.

There are three different kinds of cards in the game:

Risk Cards
Players take a Risk card and follow its instructions. Many Risk Cards can be traded with other players.

Resource Cards
Every resource shown on the Game Board has an associated resource card. This card shows the income that is payable when another player lands on the resource. It also shows the income payable if all three resources are owned and if the player has Future Technology. The resource cards can be traded with anyone except the bank.

Future Technology Cards
Players can invest in research and development and buy Future Technology, which will increase their income. This is done once players own all the resources of one organisation. There are Risk Cards that allow players to buy Future Technology without first owning all three resources.

Name: The Slippery Slope
Description:
The Slippery Slope is a board game designed to help players open up and deal with their emotions and feelings that are associated with the grief they feel when separated, going through a divorce or living through the aftermath of a single parent family.

Each player selects either a frog, race car or person, and starts moving down the slope.  The slope is labeled for the stages you go through – Denial, Bargaining, Depression, Forgiveness, and Acceptance.

Each player receives one Grace Card at the beginning of the game.  As each player rolls the die they will move 1, 2,or 3 spaces.  As they move ahead they will have to either select an Action Card (a question designed to ask – What would you do…) or a Feelings Card (a question designed to ask – How would you feel…)  Every now and then they may land on a miss a turn or move ahead or behind space.  Depending on their roll, they may also acquire additional Grace Cards.  The Grace Cards can be used at any time if they select a question they may choose to pass on.  First one to reach Acceptance wins the game.

Name: 'Inventus-Patentus'
Description:
A "roll a die and move" round a track game where one buys/charges royalties on patents rather than streets in the Monopoly manner when players land on these squares. Having adjacent sets of patents enables enhanced royalties to be charged.
 There is an added quiz element whereby when a play lands on an un-owned square, they may obtain the property for free if they can answer a question of the "Who invented ...." form.

Name: Futab
Description:
FUTAB is definitely a chess game. A game that will make you feel on the court, with all occurrences of a real game. You can experience the thrill of putting a scoring pass, connecting a center head, rally the contrary in their own area or win with a goal on the hour. I can define a tactical game and beat your rival.

FUTAB is a simulator of a soccer match. The objective is to defeat the opposing player throws the ball into the arch rival advancing through a series of boxes. To play you only need two dice and a "ball" (tab, coin, button, etc).

The board has represented the movements and plays more common in football and, through the roll of the dice and a good choice for best play, you can move forward on the grid court to reach the arch rival. The game is played to 90 dice throws.

FUTAB es definitivamente el ajedrez del fútbol. Un juego que te hará sentir dentro de la cancha, con todas las incidencias de un auténtico partido. Viví la adrenalina de meter un pase gol, conectar un centro de cabeza, pelotear al contrario en su propia área ó ganar con un gol sobre la hora. Definí una táctica de juego y vencé a tu rival.

FUTAB es un simulador de un partido de fútbol. El objetivo del mismo es vencer al jugador contrario introduciendo la pelota en el arco rival avanzando a través de una serie de casilleros. Para jugarlo solo se necesitan dos dados y una "pelota" (ficha, botón, etc).
