El tablero tiene representados los movimientos y las jugadas más comunes en los partidos de fútbol y, a través del lanzamiento del dado y una buena elección de la jugada más conveniente, se puede ir avanzando en la cancha cuadriculada hasta alcanzar el arco rival. La partida se juega a 90 lanzamientos de dado.

Name: Yrrr' it!
Description:
Two classic games - Hot Potato and Tag - are rolled into one with the talking musical disc!

Yrrr' It! is the fun new game that will have the whole neighborhood hopping, skipping and rolling around with excitement! Music starts to begin "Hot Potato" as the disc is passed from player to player. If you are the last player to touch the disc before the buzzer then... Yrrr' It! To avoid getting tagged, all other players must jump, hop, skip, and even somersault away as commands are spoken from the talking disc. Careful, you'll never know what the talking disc will say or how much time you have before the buzzer sounds in this wildly hilarious game where the winner is truly up in the air!

Name: Slap-Shot Hockey
Description: Players try to slap the puck into the opponent's goal with his stick in the hockey-board.

Name: Match Point Tennis
Description: Cadaco Match Point Tennis takes the Cadaco Bas-Ket game and adds a twist - rackets.  The two players volley back and forth over the net playing by the rules of tennis using the standard flipper mechanism.  Each player also has a racket which he can use to block shots.

Name: VI Sup
Description:
Very unusual board game from the late 70's. Each player is a mountaineer and must climb the Mont Blanc to win the game. However, the player has to earn experience points to get the skills to climb mountains, so there are 22 mountains to conquer. Each climb is harder than the previous one. You don'Ät have to climb them all, you can choose which to climb. You might, for example, climb Number One (Aiguille du Belvédère) successfully, and then try Number Four (Aiguille Purtscheller), and so on.

Each climb is illustrated for the player, with various points along the route when equipment (Alea) cards might be asked for, the more equipment you have, the better for you. And the Descent (Rappel) might cause you problems.

The board is very attractive, showing the mountain ranges. There is a curious box in the right hand corner, on which you place two tiny green frogs. These frogs move during the game and when they reach certain points on the track, the weather changes (Meteo). This weather change can be catastrophic. You might not to be able to get down a mountain you have climbed and a helicopter might be needed to get you off the mountain.

The game looks great with all the Climbs being illustrated in some detail. The playing pieces look good but are completely impractible. They are plastic Picks, in 6 colours. And they fall over far too easily. And not to forget, the two green frogs.

In my game there was a card asking me to buy their next game, which would be about skiing. However, I got no reply and I never did see a second game.

Name: Wiener Stadtbahnspiel
Description:
Players must travel around the Austrian city of Vienna in a tram, All the points of arrival has facts about the stops along the route. A die is used for movement. Quiz questions need answering at some point and the correct answers are within the rules. The winner is the first player to complete his route and return home.

I only have a reproduction of this game and I have no idea when it was first made. My edition is from the 1980's but the original must be over a hundred years old.

Name: Nénufable
Description:
Nénufable is a wooden game for children (and adults).

It's a race between frogs where the goal is to be the first frog under the balcony of the princess to be kissed by her.

Players can move ahead, put a stone or waterlily to make a road, push opponent in the water or move the princess to another balcony.

But beware... there is a sorceress in the castle who randomnly move from balcony to balcony, and if you finish under her balcony she push you in the water, and you have to restart from the begining...

Name: Bistourisq
Description:
Bistouris is a game of plastic surgery.
Each player is a patient AND a doctor.

The game takes place in two rounds.

First round, each player roll dice, move on the board and draw cards to create their own (and awful) bodies.
When the body of each player is done, the second round begin.

At the begining of the second round, each player draw a "perfect body" card to know what they need to change on their bodies.
Now players roll dice and move again on the board and try to reach on "surgery" squares to have surgery from other players... but beware... surgical procedures may fail and you end up with a body worse than before and you have twice as much work !!!
Other players bet on the result of the surgery and if it fail, the surgeon must explain what's went wrong.

The first player who manages to have a perfect body (as his "perfect body" card") is the winner

Name: Tabakitaba
Description:
Tabakitaba is an educational and fun game on tabacco.
A bit of monopoly, a hint of trivial pursuit, an inch of strategy game and some educational datas on tabacco.

One player play the tabacco industry and other players are citizens.

The goal for the tabacco industry is to convert up to citizens to smoking.
The goal for the citizens is to safeguard their health and stop smoking.

Players move on a board (the city) consting of several kind of squares (events, temptation, disease risks, tobaccological consultation) and a hex map (the rural) where citizens and tobacco industry can plant cereals or tobacco.

At the end, the player with the best health is the winner and the tobacco industry too if there are more smokers than non-smokers.

Name: Western
Description:
"The waltz of the dough ! The quest for loot!"

Western is a card game between Wanted and Cash n' Guns.

The goal is to be the first player to earn an amount of dough depending of the number of players (400.000 to 500.000 dough).

Each player begin the game with an amount of dough and some cards in hand.
There is also a bank with some money (or a money train). 
Players use cards and a round die to attack each other, trying to stole some money (or lose some if the fail !), they can also use "dirty tricks" or other protection cards and sometimes fight for the money train.
The game ends when a player has 400.000 dough.

There is 108 cards in more than 20 kinds.

Rules in french can be found on the editor website (english and other languages are coming).

Name: Battle of 4 Armies: Restoring the Crown of Chip
Description:
From designer Nathan Hansen comes a quick paced, deep decision rich, abstract strategy BattlessonTM game, Battle of 4 Armies. Match your skills against up to three opponents, for your goal is the Crown of Chip! Through the judicious use of unit placement and maneuver, you struggle to capture opposing units to knock them out of play, or hold the majority of named spaces on the board. With pressure for the center of the map and maneuver around its edges, players have myriad ways to approach every turn of this absorbing game. Make your move in the Battle of 4 Armies!

Game Data:

Complexity: 1.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents a single troop of fantasy warriors.

Game Components:

•    One 8.5” x 11” color game map
•    One 2-page, color instructions sheet
•    One BattlessonTM sheet
•    20 color, die-cut 1” mounted game pieces
